abstracts.cdata!:
This paper posits that the Metropolitan
            Area of Mexico (MCMA) has an inadequate urban transport
            system whose main negative effects are difficulty in
            mobility of people and high levels of pollution that impair
            air quality and human health. Therefore, in the medium and
            long term the Federal District Government needs to implement
            a comprehensive reform of urban transport system that favors
            efficiency and at the same time upkeeps environmental
            benefits. The paper points out the relevance of this
            argument when it is realized that 81 percent of the
            population travel by mass transit while only 19 percent use
            private vehicles. This raises the need for a transport
            system based on a design of strategic corridors of the main
            roads in Mexico City, that will result in a mass transit
            alternative that contributes to the improvement of both the
            public transport system and the metropolitan environment in general.
